meanings.definition: The most extreme or utmost effort or degree.
meanings.sent1: She put her damndest into finishing the race.
meanings.sent2: He tried his damndest to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel did its damndest to reach the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The little ant lifted the damndest pebble in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The wind blew with the damndest force, knocking over the trees.

meanings.definition: Used for emphasis to express surprise or disbelief.
meanings.sent1: Damndest! I can't believe you ate the whole cake.
meanings.sent2: Well, that's the damndest thing I've ever heard.
meanings.sent3: Damndest, you scared me with that sudden noise.
meanings.sent4: The damndest storm came out of nowhere.
meanings.sent5: Damndest, that magician made the rabbit disappear!
